alert.note: Alert for Sampson (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 29 at 2:17PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following county, Sampson. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 217 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clinton, Harrells, Roseboro, Garland, Newton Grove, Salemburg, Turkey, Falcon, Autryville, Hobbton, Spivey`s Corner and Ivanhoe.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
